issues.title: Missing Class Size Penalty Provisions
issues.description: California law requires districts to establish penalties when class size limits are exceeded. The policy mentions establishing "upper and lower class size limits" but neither the BP nor AR specify what happens when these limits are exceeded, which is required for compliance with state class size reduction funding requirements.

legal_citations.text: A school district that receives an apportionment pursuant to this article shall not enroll more than 20 pupils in any class in any of the grade levels for which the apportionment is received.

issues.required_language: The district shall establish procedures to ensure compliance with class size limits. When class size limits are exceeded, the district shall take immediate corrective action, which may include reassigning students, hiring additional teachers, or other measures to bring classes into compliance. Failure to maintain required class sizes may result in loss of state funding.

issues.title: Missing Reporting Requirements to State
issues.description: While the policy requires reports to the Board, it lacks the mandatory reporting requirements to the California Department of Education regarding class size reduction program compliance and student enrollment data.

legal_citations.text: Each school district shall report to the department, in the manner prescribed by the department, information regarding pupil enrollment and certificated employee assignments in classes for which an apportionment is received pursuant to this article.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall submit required reports to the California Department of Education regarding pupil enrollment and certificated employee assignments in classes participating in the class size reduction program, in the manner and timeline prescribed by the department.

issues.title: Missing Teacher Credential Requirements
issues.description: The documents address teacher training but fail to specify the credential requirements for teachers in class size reduction programs, which is mandated by state law for funding eligibility.

legal_citations.text: Each teacher providing direct instructional services to pupils in classes for which an apportionment is received pursuant to this article shall hold a valid teaching credential authorizing the teacher to teach the pupils to whom he or she is providing direct instructional services.

issues.required_language: All teachers providing direct instructional services in classes participating in the class size reduction program shall hold a valid teaching credential authorizing them to teach the grade level and subject matter to which they are assigned.

issues.title: Outdated Reference to Funding Availability
issues.description: The policy states classes will be reduced "as long as money is available for compliance with class size reduction regulations." This language may not reflect current state funding mechanisms and could create ambiguity about the district's commitment to class size reduction.

legal_citations.text: It is the intent of the Legislature to provide additional funding to school districts to reduce class size in kindergarten and grades 1 to 3, inclusive.

issues.required_language: The district shall maintain reduced class sizes in accordance with state law and available state funding for class size reduction programs.
